author: Arlyn

review: This was a great investment! It is well-built, easy to connect and start up, and simple to use. The remote is small, well-designed and reliable. I was especially satisfied with the voice activation feature. Access to Amazon Prime through our LAN gives us an impressive array of movies, television shows and games, and most of the ones my wife and I have watched so far have been free. Streaming through our cable provider and wireless router is smooth and continuous, with no annoying pixelation or interrupts. The unit has a small footprint, so it can be placed almost anywhere. It gives a high-quality display on small and large flat-screens. We like it so much that we bought two. Well done, Amazon.
author: Dianne G Sagan

review: Organization of application favors Amazon products and is not convenient to navigate. But most problematic is that this streaming device pulls lots of data from your internet source. This has been described as a glitch with the screen saver function. However, after turning off that function, the problem persisted in my hands. I advise to wait till all the bugs are fixed with this device.

review: I got this for my husband to hook up to the TV he most frequently watches. I also have an Apple TV which is hooked up to the TV I watch most often. We liked that we could view Amazon Prime content on this (obv) as well as Netflix and other Aps as we see fit. It works very well and my husband finds the remote much easier to understand than the Apple TV remote. Overall I still like both and find each has its benefits and drawbacks. The biggest benefit of the Apple TV comes from using other Apple devices, if you're not an Apple user (iPhone or iPad etc) then I would probably recommended the Amazon Fire TV over the Apple TV.
author: LavenderGrove "Mbb_Girl"

review: I am an Apple fan boy.  No doubt about it.  I have 2 Apple TV's in the house currently.  When this Fire TV went on sale during the holiday season, I thought i would give it a try.  Frankly, its interface is better, its faster, and i love the voice search.  In my main theater room I have both Apple TV and Amazon Fire to choose from and I find myself using Fire TV much more often.  I think its just better.
